LanguageData.AbandonedChild23.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was born sickly. Thinking that [PAWN_pronoun] would only burden the tribe, [PAWN_possessive] parents exposed [PAWN_objective] to the elements. Somehow, [PAWN_pronoun] survived.
LanguageData.AbandonedChild23.title: abandoned child
LanguageData.Bookworm19.baseDesc: Rather than socialize with the other children, [PAWN_nameDef] preferred to get lost in literature. [PAWN_pronoun] taught [PAWN_objective]self to read at an early age with books bought from passing traders.
LanguageData.Bookworm19.title: bookworm
LanguageData.BuddingArtist44.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] had a knack for art. Traders and collectors from many different societies sought to buy [PAWN_possessive] creations.
LanguageData.BuddingArtist44.title: budding artist
LanguageData.Bully70.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] tormented other children for fun. To keep [PAWN_objective] busy, an elder assigned [PAWN_objective] to a hunting party at an early age.
LanguageData.Bully70.title: bully
LanguageData.CaveChild30.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in a large and intricate cave complex that extended deep into a mountainside. [PAWN_pronoun] helped the adults maintain and improve the deep caves.
LanguageData.CaveChild30.title: cave child
LanguageData.CrashBaby32.baseDesc: As a baby, [PAWN_nameDef] was the only survivor of a deadly spacecraft crash. A passing tribe discovered [PAWN_objective] in the wreckage and adopted [PAWN_objective].
LanguageData.CrashBaby32.title: crash baby
LanguageData.FireKeeper44.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was responsible for keeping the tribe's fire going. [PAWN_pronoun] took this responsibility very seriously.
LanguageData.FireKeeper44.title: fire keeper
LanguageData.Herder19.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] tended the muffalo herds, keeping them safe from predators and treating sick animals. It was quiet work, but [PAWN_pronoun] enjoyed being away from people.
LanguageData.Herder19.title: herder
LanguageData.Hideaway7.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef]'s overprotective parents encouraged [PAWN_objective] to stay at home nearly every day. Though [PAWN_pronoun] had a lot of time to read and pursue crafting hobbies, [PAWN_pronoun] never developed normal social skills.
LanguageData.Hideaway7.title: hideaway
LanguageData.ReclusiveChild81.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] didn't learn to speak until [PAWN_pronoun] was nearly five years old. Even then [PAWN_pronoun] preferred to keep to [PAWN_objective]self.\n\nTo the chagrin of [PAWN_possessive] caretakers, [PAWN_pronoun] made a habit of wandering off to live in the wilderness for weeks at a time.
LanguageData.ReclusiveChild81.title: reclusive child
LanguageData.Scavenger22.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] spent [PAWN_possessive] childhood escaping grunt work to go digging through wrecks and ruins for treasures. [PAWN_possessive] natural curiosity got [PAWN_objective] into a lot of trouble, but it also yielded many interesting finds.
LanguageData.Scavenger22.title: scavenger
LanguageData.SoleSurvivor21.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef]'s entire tribe was wiped out in a raid. Though [PAWN_pronoun] was adopted by another group, [PAWN_pronoun] was emotionally scarred, and preferred to stay near home, cooking and tending crops.
LanguageData.SoleSurvivor21.title: sole survivor
LanguageData.TribeChild40.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in a tribe, running around the village, moving with the muffalo herds, learning essential skills from [PAWN_possessive] parents.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] never learned to read and never saw a machine that wasn't an ancient ruin.
LanguageData.TribeChild40.title: tribe child
LanguageData.VengefulChild43.baseDesc: As a child, [PAWN_nameDef] returned to [PAWN_possessive] village to find that it had been wiped out by bandits. [PAWN_pronoun] swore revenge on the attackers and began a violent rampage across the wilderness.
LanguageData.VengefulChild43.title: vengeful child
